text: Find a Program at Saint Leo

With a student to faculty ratio of 14:1, leading-edge learning technology, engaging classes focused on student success and one-on-one faculty support, we prepare students for careers in high demand fields.

Our flexible and accredited online degree programs are taught by faculty with real-world experience to prepare you to take advantage of growing career opportunities in a variety of high-demand fields.
Take courses in a traditional classroom setting in one of our 35 convenient Educations Center locations across 7 states and benefit from hands-on one-on-one assistance from our accomplished faculty.
Helping your child attend Saint Leo.
Join Us On a Virtual Tour of Campus
.  View 360-degree panoramic views and take a complete walking tour of our lakeside picturesque campus.
"As soon as I got here, I felt as though I had a home away from my home in Maine. I made my choice to attend Saint Leo because of the sense of community that the school elicits."
, an undergraduate sophomore Marketing major from Maine
"Saint Leo offers some of the best programs in the country and the staff is amazing. Being a student at Saint Leo is one of the best feelings in the world!"
, an online undergraduate junior working on her BA in Accounting

“I would consider Saint Leo University to be above and beyond military friendly. Saint Leo’s online program allowed me that flexibility to still be a father to my children, to still be a husband to my wife, and to still be able to graduate”
“I was looking for a small, hands-on, customized program with a one-on-one approach. I also wanted something that would be transferable to a real-world situation.”
, an online Creative Writing major in the master’s program who previously worked as an accountant for 30 years
"I chose Saint Leo University because of the small class sizes. The welcoming community and campus life have made my experience here even better!"
Congratulations, you have made the first step in your journey to new possibilities and opportunities.
The Graduate Admissions team welcomes you. We look forward to providing you with detailed instructions on applying to Saint Leo's graduate programs.
We are here to assist you throughout the admission process.
If you are an International graduate student, please visit the
Each graduate program has its own set of admission requirements, so follow the process for the specific program in which you are interested.
Submit your application at least 60 days prior to the beginning of the term in which you wish to enroll. Term dates are available in the
Select the applicable category below for specific admission requirements:
Saint Leo University admissions are rolling, so you can enroll at any time and begin your studies during one of our six convenient start dates throughout the year.

Admission is a simple, straightforward process. In order to become a degree-seeking student in one of our online undergraduate programs or at an Education Center, you will need to complete the following steps.
To apply for enrollment in one of Saint Leo University's associate's or bachelor's programs:
Submit the one-time $45 nonrefundable application fee.
Submit proof of high school graduation. If you have not attended another regionally accredited college or university, you must submit proof of high school graduation. This can take the form of:

Submit official academic transcripts. Provide a chronological list of all colleges and universities you have attended, even if you did not complete a full academic term. You must submit a Transcript Release Form for each regionally accredited college or university you attended or in which you were enrolled.
Download the Undergraduate Transcript Release Form
Submit official scores for the following standardized examinations, if applicable:

Advanced Placement (AP), College-Level Examination Program (CLEP), Defense Activity for Nontraditional Education Support (DANTES), Excelsior College Exams (ECE), USAFI, Regents Examinations, other applicable examinations.
Submit professional training documentation for possible academic credit.

Provide documentation if you are a graduate of a nursing training program (include license), or a police officer who has completed training with the FBI National Academy, police institute and/or certified polygraph schools. Verification of training/service is obligatory in order to obtain academic credit for your training. All non-traditional sources of credit have specific limits.
Send all these materials directly to Saint Leo University at:

Once all of a student's documents have been received, you can expect official notification of our admission decision within 30 business days. If you do not qualify for admission by meeting the usual requirements, but show promise of academic success, Saint Leo University may grant provisional admission.
Saint Leo works closely with students to make your online education affordable. If you plan to use financial aid, begin the process today to determine your eligibility.
to get started on your Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA), and find information on grants, loans and scholarships.
After you accept Saint Leo University's offer of admission, you will receive instructions on how to:

is a series of online self-paced tutorials which will guide you through everything you need to know to participate in an online classroom. You will have the opportunity to become acquainted with University resources such as the online library, how to receive textbooks, the online environment and so much more!
Take assessment exams, so we can gauge your skill level before you begin your core English and math classes.
